physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 25-cm palpable intra-abdominal mass; scalp, breast, lung masses; subcutaneous deposits along the left chest wall; melainuria; generalized silvery gray discoloration of the skin attributable to diffuse cutaneous melanosis; lactate dehydrogenase level of 7776 U/L.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time:
Generalized silvery gray discoloration developed few months before death, which is characteristic of diffuse cutaneous melanosis.
In February 2001 at 25 weeks gestation, lactate dehydrogenase level was 1418 U/L; it increased to 7776 U/L at delivery.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 6-mm lung nodule noted on chest CT scan.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially reported as a solitary lung nodule; progressed to multiple lung lesions a few months later.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Large intra-abdominal mass palpable at the time of delivery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No specific changes in findings reported.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Multiple metastatic lesions in the brain demonstrated on MRI.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition declined quickly, and the patient became increasingly cachectic leading to death on June 28, 2001.
